title: Smothered Cauliflower
introduction: Cauliflower, with its subtle taste and tender texture, takes on a new life when combined with savory olives, aromatic garlic, and optional anchovies. This dish transforms the humble cauliflower into a flavorful and satisfying side dish.
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup mild black olives, such as Gaeta, pitted and sliced
instructions: Cut the cauliflower into 2-inch florets. Trim off the ends of the stems. Cut thick stems crosswise into 1⁄4-inch slices.

Pour the oil into a large skillet and add the cauliflower. Cook over medium heat until the cauliflower begins to brown. Add the water, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Cover and cook over low heat until the cauliflower is tender when pierced with a knife and the water has evaporated, about 10 minutes.
Add the olives, anchovies, and parsley and toss well. Cook uncovered 2 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Serve hot.
